trailingComments.value:
*	This Stat computes the centroid of a cell when grid has a torus. 

	!!! Assumption: cell pixels never extend for more than half the size of the grid.
	If this assumption does not hold, centroids may be computed wrongly.
	
	See also {@link Centroids} for a version without torus correction.
		
	@example
	* let CPM = require( "path/to/build" )
	*
	* // Make a CPM, seed two cells, run a little, and get their centroids
	* let C = new CPM.CPM( [100,100], { 
	* 	T:20,
	* 	torus:true,
	* 	J:[[0,20],[20,10]],
	* 	V:[0,200],
	* 	LAMBDA_V:[0,2]
	* } )
	* let gm = new CPM.GridManipulator( C )
	* gm.seedCell(1)
	* gm.seedCell(1)
	* for( let t = 0; t < 100; t++ ){ C.timeStep() }
	*
	* C.getStat( CPM.CentroidsWithTorusCorrection )

leadingComments.value:
* The model to compute centroids on. 
		@type {GridBasedModel}

trailingComments.value: Half the grid dimensions; if pixels with the same cellid are further apart,
we assume they are on the border of the grid and that we need to correct
their positions to compute the centroid.
* @ignore

leadingComments.value: Half the grid dimensions; if pixels with the same cellid are further apart,
we assume they are on the border of the grid and that we need to correct
their positions to compute the centroid.
* @ignore

* The set model method of class CentroidsWithTorusCorrection.
	@param {GridBasedModel} M - the model to compute centroids on.

trailingComments.value: * @ignore

leadingComments.value: * @ignore
let cellpixels = this.M.getStat( PixelsByCell )

trailingComments.value: cvec will contain the x, y, (z) coordinate of the centroid.
Loop over the dimensions to compute each element separately.

leadingComments.value: cvec will contain the x, y, (z) coordinate of the centroid.
Loop over the dimensions to compute each element separately.

trailingComments.value: Loop over the pixels;
compute mean position per dimension with online algorithm

leadingComments.value: Check distance of current pixel to the accumulated mean in this dim.
Check if this distance is greater than half the grid size in this
dimension; if so, this indicates that the cell has moved to the
other end of the grid because of the torus. Note that this only
holds AFTER the first pixel (so for j > 0), when we actually have
an idea of where the cell is.
If distance is greater than half the grid size, correct the
coordinate.

trailingComments.value: Update the mean with the appropriate weight.

leadingComments.value: Update the mean with the appropriate weight.
Loop over the pixels;
compute mean position per dimension with online algorithm

trailingComments.value: Correct the final position so that it falls in the current grid.
(Because of the torus, it can happen to get a centroid at eg x = -1. )

leadingComments.value: Correct the final position so that it falls in the current grid.
(Because of the torus, it can happen to get a centroid at eg x = -1. )

trailingComments.value: Set the mean position in the cvec vector.

leadingComments.value: Set the mean position in the cvec vector.
Get object with arrays of pixels for each cell on the grid, and get
the array for the current cell.

trailingComments.value: Create an object for the centroids. Add the centroid array for each cell.

leadingComments.value: Create an object for the centroids. Add the centroid array for each cell.

*	This Stat computes the centroid of a cell when grid has a torus. 

	!!! Assumption: cell pixels never extend for more than half the size of the grid.
	If this assumption does not hold, centroids may be computed wrongly.
	
	See also {@link Centroids} for a version without torus correction.
		
	@example
	* let CPM = require( "path/to/build" )
	*
	* // Make a CPM, seed two cells, run a little, and get their centroids
	* let C = new CPM.CPM( [100,100], { 
	* 	T:20,
	* 	torus:true,
	* 	J:[[0,20],[20,10]],
	* 	V:[0,200],
	* 	LAMBDA_V:[0,2]
	* } )
	* let gm = new CPM.GridManipulator( C )
	* gm.seedCell(1)
	* gm.seedCell(1)
	* for( let t = 0; t < 100; t++ ){ C.timeStep() }
	*
	* C.getStat( CPM.CentroidsWithTorusCorrection )
